title: That items 10.a.1, 10.a.2, 10.a.3, 10.a.4, 10.a.5, and 10.a.6 be approved on Consent.

That staff report back to Council on the cost and service level implications related to garbage pick-up at various multi-residential/condominiums in the city; and, That the report include both the risks and opportunities as well as the financial implications of removing the garbage service from the tax fees paid by multi- residential/condominiums as well as the estimated cost of including green bin collection for the properties.

24-001 Being a By-law to Provide for Interim Tax Levies for the Year 2024 24-002 Being a By-law to Provide for Tax Rebates for Registered Charities 24-005 Being a By-law to temporarily exempt Blocks 126, 131 and 133, Registered Plan 45M-262 from Part Lot Control 24-006 Being a By-law to temporarily exempt Blocks 137 and 138, Registered Plan 45M-262 from Part Lot Control

24-001 Being a By-law to Provide for Interim Tax Levies for the Year 2024 24-002 Being a By-law to Provide for Tax Rebates for Registered Charities 24-005 Being a By-law to temporarily exempt Blocks 126, 131 and 133, Registered Plan 45M-262 from Part Lot Control 24-006 Being a By-law to temporarily exempt Blocks 137 and 138, Registered Plan 45M-262 from Part Lot Control That by-law 24-003, Being a By-law to authorize the 2024 acquisition of 1421 Lansdowne Street West, Peterborough at an estimated cost of $15,000,000 and the issuing of Development Charge (DC) Police supported debentures to a maximum of $9,900,000, and tax-supported debentures to a maximum of $5,100,000 to finance the work, be approved.
24-007 Being a by-law to confirm the proceedings of the Council at its meeting held on January 15, 2024
That this meeting be adjourned at 6:32 p.m.
